clearStress._description: Describe how you blow off steam or pull yourself together, and clear all marked Stress.

prepare._description: Describe how you are preparing for the next day's adventure, then gain a Hope. If you choose to Prepare with one or more members of your party, you may each take two Hope.

repairArmor._description: Describe how you spend time repairing your armor and clear all of its Armor Slots. You may also do this to an ally's armor instead.

tendToWounds._description: Describe how you patch yourself up and remove all marked Hit Points. You may also do this on an ally instead.

workOnAProject._description: Establish or continue work on a project.

tendToWounds._description: Describe how you hastily patch yourself up, then clear a number of Hit Points equal to 1d4 + your tier. You can do this to an ally instead.

clearStress._description: Describe how you blow off steam or pull yourself together, then clear a number of Stress equal to 1d4 + your tier.

repairArmor._description: Describe how you quickly repair your armor, then clear a number of Armor Slots equal to 1d4 + your tier. You can do this to an ally's armor instead.

prepare._description: Describe how you prepare yourself for the path ahead, then gain a Hope. If you choose to Prepare with one or more members of your party, you each gain 2 Hope.

creatureComfort._description: Once per rest, when you take time during a quiet moment to give your companion love and attention, you can gain a Hope or you can both clear a Stress.

armored._description: When your companion takes damage, you can mark one of your Armor Slots instead of marking one of their Stress.

bonded._description: When you mark your last Hit Point, your companion rushes to your side to comfort you. Roll a number of d6s equal to the unmarked Stress slots they have and mark them. If any roll a 6, your companion helps you up. Clear your last Hit Point and return to the scene.

choiceDescriptions._attributes: Gain a +1 bonus to two unmarked character traits and mark them.
choiceDescriptions._hitPointSlots: Permanently gain one Hit Point slot.
choiceDescriptions._experiences: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to two experiences.
choiceDescriptions._domainCard: Choose an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to (up to level {maxLevel})
choiceDescriptions._evasion: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion.
choiceDescriptions._subclass: Take an upgraded subclass card. Then cross out the multiclass option for this tier.
choiceDescriptions._multiclass: Multiclass: Choose an additional class for your character, then cross out an unused “Take an upgraded subclass card” and the other multiclass option on this sheet.

delevel._content: Returning to the previous level selection will remove all selections made for this level. Do you want to proceed?

options._trait: Gain a +1 bonus to two unmarked character traits and mark them.
options._hitPoint: Permanently gain one Hit Point slot.
options._experience: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to two experiences.
options._domainCard: Choose an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to (up to level {maxLevel})
options._evasion: Permanently gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion.
options._subclass: Take an upgraded subclass card. Then cross out the multiclass option for this tier.
options._multiclass: Multiclass: Choose an additional class for your character, then cross out an unused “Take an upgraded subclass card” and the other multiclass option on this sheet.
options._intelligent: Your companion gains a permanent +1 bonus to a Companion Experience of your choice.
options._lightInTheDark: Gain an additional Hope slot for your character.
options._creatureComfort: Once per rest, when you take time during a quiet moment to give your companion love and attention, you can gain a Hope or you can both clear a Stress.
options._armored: When your companion takes damage, you can mark one of your Armor Slots instead of marking one of their Stress.
options._vicious: Increase your companion's damage dice or range by one step (d6 to d8, Close to Far, etc.)
options._resilient: Your companion gains an additional Stress slot.
options._bonded: When you mark your last Hit Point, your companion rushes to your side to comfort you. Roll a number of d6s equal to the unmarked Stress slots they have and mark them. If any roll a 6, your companion helps you up. Clear your last Hit Point and return to the scene.
options._aware: Your companion gains a permanent +2 bonus to their Evasion.

tier2._infoLabel: At Level 2, gain an additional Experience at +2 and gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency.
tier2._pretext: Choose two options from the list below
tier2._posttext: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

tier3._infoLabel: At Level 5, take an additional Experience and clear all marks on Character Traits.
tier3._pretext: When you level up, record it on your character sheet, then choose two from the list below or any unmarked from the previous tier.
tier3._posttext: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

tier4._infoLabel: At Level 8, take an additional Experience and clear all marks on Character Traits.
tier4._pretext: When you level up, record it on your character sheet, then choose two from the list below or any unmarked from the previous tier.
tier4._posttext: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

MulticlassChoice._explanation: You are adding {class} as your multiclass

RerollDialog._deselectDiceNotification: Deselect one of the selected dice first

relentless._description: A foe with Relentless can activate up to X times during a GM move so long as there are enough action tokens.
relentless._tip: The Relentless move is useful if you want an adversary you can activate more than once during a single GM move. This is often best for exceedingly fast or dangerous foes, or for adversaries who are likely to be battling the party on their own.

slow._description: A foe with Slow costs X action tokens to activate.
slow._tip: The Slow move is useful if you want an adversary who narratively takes longer to act than others, like a slug creature or a massive ogre. This is usually most effective when that creature is very powerful when it does act, but eats up lots of action tokens to do it.

minion._description: For every X damage a PC deals to this adversary, they also deal 1 HP to an additional minion within their attack’s range.
minion._tip: The Minion move is useful when you want to drop lots of small enemies into the battlefield, knowing the party can swing through them very easily. This move means that if a PC hits one minion and they do enough damage, they also hit a number of others that are in range for them. Because of this, it’s often best to have minions crowd a PC–it will feel overwhelming and dangerous until they’re able to make an attack against them. If you want that cinematic feeling of the PCs taking out waves of enemies with a single attack roll, minions are a great tool to make that happen.

horde._description: A Horde represents a number of foes working in a group.

leader._description: Adversaries that command and summon other adversaries.

minion._description: Basic enemies that are easily dispatched but dangerous in numbers.

ranged._description: Adversaries that attack from a distance.

skulk._description: Adversaries that maneuver and exploit opportunities to ambush their opponents.

social._description: Adversaries that are primarily interpersonal threats or challenges.

solo._description: Designed to present a challenge to a whole party.

support._description: Enemies that enhance their allies and/or disrupt their opponents.

burning._description: When an adversary attacks you within Melee range, they mark a Stress.

burn._description: When an adversary attacks you within Melee range, they mark a Stress.

difficult._description: -1 to all character traits and Evasion
-1 to all character traits and Evasion

fortified._description: When you mark an Armor Slot, you reduce the severity of an attack by two thresholds instead of one.
When you mark an Armor Slot, you reduce the severity of an attack by two thresholds instead of one.

hopeful._description: When you would spend a Hope, you can mark an Armor Slot instead.

hope._description: When you would spend a Hope, you can mark an Armor Slot instead.

impenetrable._description: Once per short rest, when you would mark your last Hit Point, you can instead mark a Stress.
Once per short rest, when you would mark your last Hit Point, you can instead mark a Stress.

magical._description: You can't mark an Armor Slot to reduce physical damage.
You can't mark an Armor Slot to reduce physical damage.

painful._description: Each time you mark an Armor Slot, you must mark a Stress.

pain._description: Each time you mark an Armor Slot, you must mark a Stress.

physical._description: You can't mark an Armor Slot to reduce magic damage.
You can't mark an Armor Slot to reduce magic damage.

quiet._description: You gain a +2 bonus to rolls you make to move silently.
You gain a +2 bonus to rolls you make to move silently.

reinforced._description: When you mark your last Armor Slot, increase your damage thresholds by +2 until you clear at least 1 Armor Slot.

reinforce._description: When you mark your last Armor Slot, increase your damage thresholds by +2 until you clear at least 1 Armor Slot.

reinforced._description: When you mark your last Armor Slot, increase your damage thresholds by +2 until you clear at least 1 Armor Slot.

resilient._description: Before you mark your last Armor Slot, roll a d6. On a result of 6, reduce the severity by one threshold without marking an Armor Slot.
Before you mark your last Armor Slot, roll a d6. On a result of 6, reduce the severity by one threshold without marking an Armor Slot.

sharp._description: On a successful attack against a target within Melee range, add a d4 to the damage roll.
On a successful attack against a target within Melee range, add a d4 to the damage roll.

shifting._description: When you are targeted for an attack, you can mark an Armor Slot to give the attack roll against you disadvantage.

shift._description: When you are targeted for an attack, you can mark an Armor Slot to give the attack roll against you disadvantage.

timeslowing._description: Mark an Armor Slot to roll a d4 and add its result as a bonus to your Evasion against an incoming attack.

slowTime._description: Mark an Armor Slot to roll a d4 and add its result as a bonus to your Evasion against an incoming attack.

truthseeking._description: This armor glows when another creature within Close range tells a lie.
This armor glows when another creature within Close range tells a lie.

warded._description: You reduce incoming magic damage by your Armor Score before applying it to your damage thresholds.
You reduce incoming magic damage by your Armor Score before applying it to your damage thresholds.

hidden._description:
While Hidden, attacks cannot be made directly targeting them nd any rolls against them are at disadvantage.
When a Hidden creature moves or attacks, they are no longer Hidden. However, if a creature is Hidden when they begin making an attack, the roll has advantage; the Hidden condition isn’t cleared until after the attack is resolved.

restrained._description:
When an effect makes a creature Restrained, it means they cannot move until this condition is cleared.
They can still take actions from their current position.

unconscious._description: Your character can’t move or act while unconscious, they can’t be targeted by an attack.

vulnerable._description:
While a creature is Vulnerable, all rolls targeting them have advantage.
A creature who is already Vulnerable can’t be made to take the condition again.

avoidDeath._description: You drop unconscious temporarily and work with the GM to describe how the situation gets much worse because of it. Then roll your Fear die; if its value is equal to or under your Level, take a Scar.

riskItAll._description: Roll your Duality Dice. If Hope is higher, you stay on your feet and clear an amount of Hit Points and/or Stress equal to the value of the Hope die (divide the Hope die value up between these however you’d prefer). If your Fear die is higher, you cross through the veil of death. If the Duality Dice are tied, you stay on your feet and clear all Hit Points and Stress.

blazeOfGlory._description: With Blaze of Glory, the player is accepting death for the character. Take one action (at GM discretion), which becomes an automatic critical success, then cross through the veil of death.

melee._description: means a character is within touching distance of the target. PCs can generally touch targets up to a few feet away from them, but melee range may be greater for especially large NPCs.

veryClose._description: means a distance where one can see fine details of a target- within moments of reaching, if need be. This is usually anywhere from about 5-10 feet away. While in danger, a PC can usually get to anything that’s very close as part of any other action they take. Anything on a battle map that is within the shortest length of a game card (~2-3 inches) can usually be considered very close.

close._description: means a distance where one can see prominent details of a target-- across a room or to a neighboring market stall, generally about 10-30 feet away. While in danger, a PC can usually get to anything that’s close as part of any other action they take. Anything on a battle map that is within the length of a standard pen or pencil (~5-6 inches) can usually be considered close.

far._description: means a distance where one can see the appearance of a person or object, but probably not in great detail-- across a small battlefield or down a large corridor. This is usually about 30-100 feet away. While under danger, a PC will likely have to make an Agility check to get here safely. Anything on a battle map that is within the length of a standard piece of paper (~10-11 inches) can usually be considered far.

veryFar._description: means a distance where you can see the shape of a person or object, but probably not make outany details-- across a large battlefield or down a long street, generally about 100-300 feet away. While under danger, a PC likely has to make an Agility check to get here safely. Anything on a battle map that is beyond far distance, but still within sight of the characters can usually be considered very far.

doubledUp._description: When you make an attack with your primary weapon, you can deal damage to another target within Melee range.

doubleUp._description: When you make an attack with your primary weapon, you can deal damage to another target within Melee range.

dueling._description: When there are no other creatures within Close range of the target, gain advantage on your attack roll against them.

duel._description: When there are no other creatures within Close range of the target, gain advantage on your attack roll against them.

eruptive._description: On a successful attack against a target within Melee range, all other adversaries within Very Close range must succeed on a reaction roll (14) or take half damage.

sheltering._description: When you mark an Armor Slot, it reduces damage for you and all allies within Melee range of you who took the same damage.

Attachments._transferHint: If checked, this effect will be applied to any actor that owns this Effect's parent Item. The effect is always applied if this Item is attached to another one.

longRestMoves._hint: The number of extra Long Rest Moves the character can take during a Short Rest.

longRestMoves._hint: The number of extra Long Rest Moves the character can take during a Long Rest.

maxLoadout.label: Bonificador de cartas máximas en la mano

physicalResistance._hint: Physical Damage is halved if this is set to 1

magicalResistance._hint: Magical Damage is halved if this is set to 1

physicalImmunity._hint: Immune to Physical Damage if this is set to 1

magicalImmunity._hint: Immune to Magical Damage if this is set to 1

physicalReduction._hint: Physical Damage is reduced by the amount set here

magicalReduction._hint: Magical Damage is reduced by the amount set here

arcana.label: Arcano
arcana._description: This is the domain of the innate or instinctual use of magic. Those who walk this path tap into the raw, enigmatic forces of the realms to manipulate both the elements and their own energy. Arcana offers wielders a volatile power, but it is incredibly potent when correctly channeled.

blade.label: Filo
blade._description: This is the domain of those who dedicate their lives to the mastery of weapons. Whether by blade, bow, or perhaps a more specialized arm, those who follow this path have the skill to cut short the lives of others. Blade requires study and dedication from its followers, in exchange for inexorable power over death.

bone.label: Hueso
bone._description: This is the domain of mastery of swiftness and tactical mastery. Practitioners of this domain have an uncanny control over their own physical abilities, and an eye for predicting the behaviors of others in combat. Bone grants its adherents unparalleled understanding of bodies and their movements in exchange for diligent training.

codex.label: Códex
codex._description: This is the domain of intensive magical study. Those who seek magical knowledge turn to the recipes of power recorded in books, on scrolls, etched into walls, or tattooed on bodies. Codex offers a commanding and versatile understanding of magic to those devotees who are willing to seek beyond the common knowledge.

grace.label: Gracia
grace._description: This is the domain of charisma. Through rapturous storytelling, clever charm, or a shroud of lies, those who channel this power define the realities of their adversaries, bending perception to their will. Grace offers its wielders raw magnetism and mastery over language.

midnight.label: Medianoche
midnight._description: This is the domain of shadows and secrecy. Whether by clever tricks, or cloak of night those who channel these forces are practiced in that art of obscurity and there is nothing hidden they cannot reach. Midnight offers practitioners the incredible power to control and create enigmas.

sage.label: Sabio
sage._description: This is the domain of the natural world. Those who walk this path tap into the unfettered power of the earth and its creatures to unleash raw magic. Sage grants its adherents the vitality of a blooming flower and ferocity of a hungry predator.

splendor.label: Esplendor
splendor._description: This is the domain of life. Through this magic, followers gain the ability to heal, though such power also grants the wielder some control over death. Splendor offers its disciples the magnificent ability to both give and end life.

valor.label: Valor
valor._description: This is the domain of protection. Whether through attack or defense, those who choose this discipline channel formidable strength to protect their allies in battle. Valor offers great power to those who raise their shield in defense of others.

increasePerArmorMark._hint: A used armor slot normally reduces damage by one step. This value increases the number of steps damage is reduced by.

maxArmorMarkedStress._hint: If this value is set you can use up to that much stress to spend additional Armor Marks beyond your normal maximum.

any._hint: The cost in stress you can pay to reduce incoming damage down one threshold

severe._hint: The cost in stress you can pay to reduce severe damage down to major.

major._hint: The cost in stress you can pay to reduce major damage down to minor.

minor._hint: The cost in stress you can pay to reduce minor damage to none.

dice._hint: Index for the damage dice used on the basic attack. 0=d4, 1=d6, 2=d8, 3=d10, 4=d12, 5=d20

Beastform._evolvedDrag: Drag a form here to evolve it.
Beastform._hybridizeDrag: Drag a form here to hybridize it.

fear._hint: Automatically increase the GM's fear pool on a fear duality roll result.

damageReductionRulesDefault._hint: Wether using armor and reductions has rules on by default

levelupAuto._hint: When you've made your choices and finish levelup, the numerical changes are automatically applied to your character.

actionPoints._hint: Automatically give and take Action Points as combatants take their turns.

hordeDamage._hint: Automatically active horde effect to lower damage when reaching half or lower HP.

rangeDependent._hint: Effects with defined range dependency will automatically turn on/off depending on range

resourceScrollTexts._hint: When a character is damaged, uses armor etc, a scrolling text will briefly appear by the token to signify this.

playerCanEditSheet._label: Players Can Manually Edit Character Settings
playerCanEditSheet._hint: Players are allowed to access the manual Character Settings and change their statistics beyond the rules.

Homebrew._resetMovesText: Are you sure you want to reset?

maxLoadout._hint: Set to blank or 0 for unlimited maximum

maxDomains._hint: Max domains you can set on a class

domains._deleteDomainText: Are you sure you want to delete the {name} domain? It will be immediately removed from all Actors in this world where it's currently used. Compendiums are not cleared.
domains._duplicateDomain: There is already a domain with this identification.

automation._hint: Various settings automating resource management and more

homebrew._hint: Various settings allowing extensions to types or altered game rules

range._hint: System ruler setup for displaying ranges in Daggerheart

appearance._hint: Modify the look of various parts of the system

diceSoNice._hint: Coloration of Duality dice if the Dice So Nice module is used.

variantRules._hint: Apply variant rules from the Daggerheart system

fear._hint: The Fear pool of the GM.

ResetSettings._resetConfirmationText: Are you sure you want to reset the {settings}?

reroll._confirmText: Are you sure you want to reroll?

Notifications._adversaryMissing: The linked adversary doesn't exist in the world.
Notifications._beastformInapplicable: A beastform can only be applied to a Character.

Notifications._attackTargetDoesNotExist: The target token no longer exists

Notifications._lacksDomain: Your character doesn't have the domain of the card!
Notifications._duplicateDomainCard: You already have a domain card with that name!
Notifications._missingClassOrSubclass: The character doesn't have a class and subclass
Notifications._tooHighLevel: You cannot raise the character level past the maximum
Notifications._tooLowLevel: You cannot lower the character level below starting level
Notifications._subclassNotInClass: This subclass does not belong to your selected class.
Notifications._subclassNotInMulticlass: This subclass does not belong to your selected multiclass.
Notifications._missingClass: You don't have a class selected yet.
Notifications._wrongDomain: The card isn't from one of your class domains.
Notifications._cardTooHighLevel: The card is too high level!
Notifications._duplicateCard: You cannot select the same card more than once.
Notifications._notPrimary: The weapon is not a primary weapon!
Notifications._notSecondary: The weapon is not a secondary weapon!
Notifications._itemTooHighTier: The item must be from Tier1
Notifications._primaryIsTwoHanded: Cannot select a secondary weapon with a two-handed primary!
Notifications._noMoreMoves: You cannot select any more downtime moves
Notifications._damageAlreadyNone: The damage has already been reduced to none
Notifications._noAvailableArmorMarks: You have no more available armor marks
Notifications._unownedActionMacro: Cannot make a Use macro for an Action not on your character
Notifications._unownedAttackMacro: Cannot make a Use macro for an Attack that doesn't belong to one of your characters
Notifications._featureNotHope: This feature is used as something else than a Hope feature and cannot be used here.
Notifications._featureNotClass: This feature is used as something else than a Class feature and cannot be used here.
Notifications._featureNotPrimary: This feature is used as something else than a Primary feature and cannot be used here.
Notifications._featureNotSecondary: This feature is used as something else than a Secondary feature and cannot be used here.
Notifications._featureNotFoundation: This feature is used as something else than a Foundation feature and cannot be used here.

Notifications._beastformMissingEffect: The Beastform is missing a Beastform Effect. Cannot be used.
Notifications._beastformToManyAdvantages: You cannot select any more advantages.
Notifications._beastformToManyFeatures: You cannot select any more features.
Notifications._beastformEquipWeapon: You cannot use weapons while in a Beastform.
Notifications._loadoutMaxReached: You've reached maximum loadout. Move atleast one domain card to the vault, or increase the limit in homebrew settings if desired.
Notifications._domainMaxReached: You've reached the maximum domains for the class. Increase the limit in homebrew settings if desired.
Notifications._multiclassAlreadyPresent: You already have a class and multiclass
Notifications._subclassesAlreadyPresent: You already have a class and multiclass subclass
Notifications._noDiceSystem: Your selected dice {system} does not have a {faces} dice

Tooltip._maxHPClassBound: Your max HP base is set on your class. This is the increase ontop of that.
